H0.text: when did the prr first begin its passenger service between pittsburgh and philadelphia. 1838

H1.text: when did the prr first begin its passenger service between pittsburgh and philadelphia. 1849

H2.text: when did the prr first begin its passenger service between pittsburgh and philadelphia. 1820

H3.text: when did the prr first begin its passenger service between pittsburgh and philadelphia. 1854

A4.text: In 1852, a continuous railroad line ran between Philadelphia and Pittsburgh over the tracks of several entities including the Pennsylvania Railroad.

A5.text: In 1853, the Pennsy was granted trackage rights over the Philadelphia and Columbia, providing a connection between the two cities and connecting with the HPMtJ&L at Lancaster and Columbia.

A6.text: on November 29 the full line was completed, forming the first all-rail route between Philadelphia and Pittsburgh
